I donâ€™t know if this has been proposed before, but has there been consideration for adding once_cell or an equivalent to std? Lazily initialised static variables are one of the most common patterns in Rust. lazy_static, lazycell and once_cell combined have about 37 million downloads on crates.io; which makes them the more popular than rand. Looking at the code for all of these implementations are all relatively straightforward and small, so it seems like it wouldn't have a substantial impact on the std library while providing huge amount of utility.

Cc @matklad
Oh wow, I love when something I want is already done. :big_smile:
that's a non-thread-safe version of this API though, isn't it?
I think correctness crucially relies on this being sequential, but the comments do not say so
but AFAIK lazy_static needs something no_std that is Sync? this is what leads to https://github.com/rust-lang-nursery/lazy-static.rs/issues/150 which I still think is highly problematic
